IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ESTABLISH & OVERSEE A COMMUNITY-WIDE NETWORK OF AGENCIES & EMPLOYERS FOR DELIVERY OF THE HIGHEST-QUALITY WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SERVICES TO ITS JOB-SEEKER & EMPLOYER CUSTOMERS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF HEARTLAND WORKS, INC. IS TO ESTABLISH AND OVERSEE A COMMUNITY-WIDE NETWORK OF AGENCIES AND EMPLOYERS FOR DELIVERY OF THE HIGHEST-QUALITY WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SERVICES TO ITS JOB-SEEKER AND EMPLOYER CUSTOMERS, BY (1) ASSISTING YOUTH TO FURTHER THEIR EDUCATION, (2) ENCOURAGING YOUTH AND ADULTS TO ENGAGE IN LIFE-LONG LEARNING, (3) PREPARING YOUTH AND ADULTS FOR ENTRY INTO AND ADVANCEMENT WITHIN THE LABOR FORCE, AND (4) ASSISTING EMPLOYERS TO FIND QUALIFIED WORKERS AND IMPROVE THE CAPABILITIES OF THE WORKFORCE, AND THEREBY TO IMPROVE ECONOMIC CONDITIONS FOR ALL RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES WITHIN THE LOCAL AREA.
IRS990.Desc: HEARTLAND WORKS, INC. SERVES ELIGIBLE PARTICIPANTS THROUGH PROGRAMS FEDERALLY FUNDED THROUGH WORKFORCE INNOVATION OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) FUNDS AND OTHER PROGRAMS. THE COMMON PURPOSE OF THESE FUNDS IS TO ASSIST ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, UNDEREMPLOYED AND/OR EMPLOYED WORKERS BECOME SELF-SUFFICIENT. THESE FUNDS ALSO HELP PREPARE A SKILLED WORKFORCE FOR EMPLOYERS. HEARTLAND WORKS, INC. ALSO ADMINISTERS ONE-STOP CENTERS IN NORTHEAST KANSAS PROVIDING STREAMLINED SERVICES AND ACCESSIBILITY FOR BOTH JOB SEEKERS AND EMPLOYERS.

ContractorCompensationGrp.ServicesDesc: YOUTH PROGRAM SERVICE AND PARTICIPANT TR

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS REQUIRED TO ASSESS WHETHER IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT A TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION ASSUMING THE TAXING AUTHORITY HAS FULL KNOWLEDGE OF ALL INFORMATION. IF THE TAX POSITION DOES NOT MEET THE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT RECOGNITION THRESHOLD, THE BENEFIT OF THAT POSITION IS NOT RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS DETERMINED THERE ARE NO AMOUNTS TO RECORD AS ASSETS OR LIABILITIES RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: TRAINING & OTHER ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO WIOA AND JOB OPPORTUNITY PARTICIPANTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THROUGH COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE CHIEF ELECTED OFFICIALS BOARD OF KANSAS WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT LOCAL AREA II, COMPRISED OF REPRESENTATIVES OF ONE OR MORE OF THE COUNTIES OF OSAGE, SHAWNEE, DOUGLAS, FRANKLIN, JEFFERSON, JACKSON, POTTAWATOMIE, RILEY, WABAUNSEE, CLAY, GEARY, ATCHISON, BROWN, DONIPHAN, MARSHALL, NEMAHA AND WASHINGTON, AND THE CITY OF TOPEKA, WHICH IS THE AREA HEARTLAND WORKS, INC. SERVES. BOARD MEMBERS SHALL BE REPRESENTATIVE OF THE GENERAL POPULATION IN THE LOCAL AREA AND MEET ALL WORKFORCE INNOVATION & OPPORTUNITY ACT OF 2014 REQUIREMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS COMPLETED IN COORDINATION WITH THE ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDITORS, THE SENIOR FINANCE DIRECTOR AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE FINAL DRAFT OF THE 990 WAS FORWARDED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD VIA EMAIL WITH COMMENTS REGARDING ANY FINAL CORRECTIONS/CHANGES. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWED AND SUBMITTED ANY FINAL COMMENTS/RECOMMENDATIONS WHICH IN TURN WERE IMPLEMENTED IN THE FINAL COPY SUBMITTED TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. ALL CORRESPONDENCE AND COMMENTS/RECOMMENDATIONS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE PERMANENT 990 - 2021 FILE MAINTAINED IN THE HEARTLAND WORKS, INC.'S ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS COMPLETE THE "CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM". MANAGEMENT STAFF MAKE NOTE OF BOARD MEMBERS AFFILIATED INTERESTS AND ENSURE SUCH BOARD MEMBERS ARE NOT INVOLVED IN PROCUREMENT PROCEDURES, CONTRACT APPROVAL, AWARDING OF FUNDS, ETC. THAT WOULD INVOLVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. MEMBERS ARE REQUESTED TO ABSTAIN FROM ANY VOTING ACTION THAT INVOLVES ANY AFFILIATED INTERESTS AND SUCH ABSTENTIONS ARE RECORDED IN OFFICIAL MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EMPLOYEES ARE COMPENSATED SALARIES AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. BENEFITS INCLUDE HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE, $30,000 LIFE INSURANCE COVERAGE, SHORT TERM AND LONG TERM DISABILITY AND A 5% (OF GROSS SALARY) EMPLOYER CONTRIBUTION IN THE 403(B) RETIREMENT PLAN WHEN THE EMPLOYEE IS ELIGIBLE TO PARTICIPATE. EMPLOYEES MAY DEFER PART OF THEIR SALARIES INTO A SECTION 125 PLAN FOR COVERAGE OF DEPENDENTS AND SPOUSE HEALTH INSURANCE AND MAY DEFER PART OF THEIR SALARIES INTO THE 403(B) RETIREMENT PLAN. EMPLOYEES ARE NOT ELIGIBLE TO VOTE DURING BOARD OF DIRECTOR'S MEETINGS. BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE VOLUNTEERS AND ARE NOT COMPENSATED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE AT WWW.HEARTLANDWORKS.ORG. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
